alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 26 at 4:56AM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: .A strong, but brief, atmospheric river event will bring very heavy rainfall rates to the southern coast this evening into Tuesday. Being the first very heavy rain event, debris that has been building up through the summer and fall will be washed down with the high rainfall rates. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Oregon, including the following area, Curry County Coast. * WHEN...From this evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Very heavy rainfall rates will wash debris that will possibly block culverts and other drainages. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
